classes.name: SSLContext
classes.description: Represents an implementation of a secure socket protocol. Acts as a factory for SSLSocketFactory, SSLServerSocketFactory, and SSLEngine. Initialized with optional KeyManager, TrustManager, and SecureRandom.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: protocol
params.description: The standard name of the requested protocol (e.g., TLS, TLSv1.2, TLSv1.3)

methods.description: Returns an SSLContext object that implements the specified secure socket protocol.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: protocol
params.description: The standard name of the requested protocol

params.name: provider
params.description: The name of the provider

methods.description: Returns an SSLContext object that implements the specified secure socket protocol from the specified provider.

methods.name: getDefault
methods.description: Returns the default SSL context. The default context is initialized with default KeyManager, TrustManager, and SecureRandom.

methods.name: setDefault

params.name: context
params.description: The SSLContext to set as the default

methods.description: Sets the default SSL context. The context must have been initialized before being passed to this method.

methods.name: init

params.name: km
params.description: The sources of authentication keys, or null

params.name: tm
params.description: The sources of peer authentication trust decisions, or null

params.name: random
params.description: The source of randomness, or null for default implementation

methods.description: Initializes this context. Either of the first two parameters may be null, in which case the installed security providers will be searched for the highest priority implementation of the appropriate factory.

methods.name: getSocketFactory
methods.description: Returns a SocketFactory object for this context. Used to create SSLSocket instances for client-side SSL connections.

methods.name: getServerSocketFactory
methods.description: Returns a ServerSocketFactory object for this context. Used to create SSLServerSocket instances for server-side SSL connections.

methods.name: createSSLEngine
methods.description: Creates a new SSLEngine using this context. Applications using this factory method are providing no hints for an internal session reuse strategy.

methods.name: createSSLEngine

params.name: peerHost
params.description: The non-authoritative name of the host

params.name: peerPort
params.description: The non-authoritative port

methods.description: Creates a new SSLEngine using this context with advisory peer information. The peer host and port are used as hints for an internal session reuse strategy.

methods.name: getDefaultSSLParameters
methods.description: Returns a copy of the SSLParameters indicating the default settings for this SSL context.

methods.name: getSupportedSSLParameters
methods.description: Returns a copy of the SSLParameters indicating the supported settings for this SSL context.

methods.name: getProtocol
methods.description: Returns the protocol name of this SSLContext object.

classes.name: HttpsURLConnection
classes.description: Extends HttpURLConnection with support for HTTPS-specific features such as SSL socket factories and hostname verifiers. Used to make HTTPS requests with certificate and hostname verification control.

methods.name: setDefaultSSLSocketFactory

params.name: sf
params.description: The default SSL socket factory

methods.description: Sets the default SSLSocketFactory inherited by new instances of this class. Newly created instances will use this factory unless overridden by setSSLSocketFactory.

methods.name: getDefaultSSLSocketFactory
methods.description: Gets the default static SSLSocketFactory used when creating sockets for secure HTTPS URL connections.

methods.name: setDefaultHostnameVerifier

params.name: v
params.description: The default hostname verifier

methods.description: Sets the default HostnameVerifier inherited by new instances of this class. Newly created instances will use this verifier unless overridden by setHostnameVerifier.

methods.name: getDefaultHostnameVerifier
methods.description: Gets the default HostnameVerifier used when creating new HTTPS URL connections.

methods.name: setSSLSocketFactory

params.name: sf
params.description: The SSL socket factory

methods.description: Sets the SSLSocketFactory to be used for this particular HttpsURLConnection.

methods.name: getSSLSocketFactory
methods.description: Gets the SSLSocketFactory used for this connection.

methods.name: setHostnameVerifier

params.name: v
params.description: The hostname verifier

methods.description: Sets the HostnameVerifier for this particular HttpsURLConnection.

methods.name: getHostnameVerifier
methods.description: Gets the HostnameVerifier in place on this instance.

methods.name: getCipherSuite
methods.description: Returns the cipher suite in use on this connection.

methods.name: getServerCertificates
methods.description: Returns the server's certificate chain which was established as part of defining the session. Throws SSLPeerUnverifiedException if the peer is not verified.

methods.name: getPeerPrincipal
methods.description: Returns the server's principal which was established as part of defining the session. Throws SSLPeerUnverifiedException if the peer is not verified.

methods.name: setRequestMethod

params.name: method
params.description: The HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE)

methods.description: Sets the request method (GET, POST, PUT, etc.). Inherited from HttpURLConnection.

methods.name: getResponseCode
methods.description: Gets the HTTP response status code (e.g., 200 for OK, 404 for Not Found). Inherited from HttpURLConnection.

methods.name: getResponseMessage

returns.description: The HTTP response message (e.g., OK, Not Found)

methods.description: Gets the HTTP response message returned along with the response code. Inherited from HttpURLConnection.

methods.name: setRequestProperty

params.name: key
params.description: The keyword of the request header (e.g., Content-Type, Authorization)

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the request header

methods.description: Sets the general request property. If a property with the key already exists, overwrite its value. Inherited from URLConnection.

methods.name: getInputStream

returns.description: An input stream that reads from this connection

methods.description: Returns an input stream that reads from this open connection. Used to read the response body. Inherited from URLConnection.

methods.name: getErrorStream

returns.description: An error stream, or null if no error

methods.description: Returns the error stream if the connection failed but the server sent useful data (e.g., a 404 page). Inherited from HttpURLConnection.

methods.name: getOutputStream

returns.description: An output stream that writes to this connection

methods.description: Returns an output stream that writes to this connection. Used to send request body data. Inherited from URLConnection.

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Indicates that other requests to the server are unlikely in the near future. Releases resources. Inherited from HttpURLConnection.

methods.name: setDoOutput

params.name: dooutput
params.description: True to allow sending data

methods.description: Sets whether this connection allows sending data (output). Must be true for POST/PUT requests. Inherited from URLConnection.

methods.name: setDoInput

params.name: doinput
params.description: True to allow reading data

methods.description: Sets whether this connection allows receiving data (input). Defaults to true. Inherited from URLConnection.

methods.name: setConnectTimeout

params.name: timeout
params.description: Timeout in milliseconds (0 means infinite)

methods.description: Sets a specified timeout value, in milliseconds, for opening a connection to the resource. Inherited from URLConnection.

methods.name: setReadTimeout

params.name: timeout
params.description: Timeout in milliseconds (0 means infinite)

methods.description: Sets the read timeout, in milliseconds. A non-zero value specifies the timeout when reading from the input stream. Inherited from URLConnection.

methods.name: getContentType

returns.description: The content type of the resource, or null

methods.description: Returns the value of the content-type header field. Inherited from URLConnection.

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Opens a communications link to the resource if such a connection has not already been established. Inherited from URLConnection.

classes.name: TrustManagerFactory
classes.description: Acts as a factory for TrustManager objects based on a source of trust material. Used to validate remote certificates during SSL/TLS handshakes.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The standard name of the requested trust management algorithm (e.g., PKIX, SunX509)

methods.description: Returns a TrustManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for trust managers.

methods.name: getDefaultAlgorithm
methods.description: Obtains the default TrustManagerFactory algorithm name. The default algorithm can be changed at runtime by setting the ssl.TrustManagerFactory.algorithm security property.

methods.name: init

params.name: ks
params.description: The key store, or null to use the default trust store

methods.description: Initializes this factory with a source of certificate authorities and related trust material. If the KeyStore parameter is null, the default trust store is used.

methods.name: getTrustManagers
methods.description: Returns one trust manager for each type of trust material. Usually returns a single X509TrustManager.

methods.name: getAlgorithm

returns.description: The algorithm name of this TrustManagerFactory

methods.description: Returns the algorithm name of this TrustManagerFactory object.

classes.name: KeyManagerFactory
classes.description: Acts as a factory for KeyManager objects based on a source of key material. Used to provide client authentication credentials during SSL/TLS handshakes.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The standard name of the requested key management algorithm (e.g., SunX509, PKIX)

methods.description: Returns a KeyManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for key managers.

methods.name: getDefaultAlgorithm
methods.description: Obtains the default KeyManagerFactory algorithm name. The default algorithm can be changed at runtime by setting the ssl.KeyManagerFactory.algorithm security property.

methods.name: init

params.name: ks
params.description: The key store containing key material, or null

params.name: password
params.description: The password for recovering keys in the KeyStore

methods.description: Initializes this factory with a source of key material. The provider typically uses a KeyStore for obtaining key material for use during secure socket negotiations.

methods.name: getKeyManagers
methods.description: Returns one key manager for each type of key material. Usually returns a single X509KeyManager.

methods.name: getAlgorithm

returns.description: The algorithm name of this KeyManagerFactory

methods.description: Returns the algorithm name of this KeyManagerFactory object.

classes.name: SSLParameters
classes.description: Encapsulates parameters for an SSL/TLS connection. Includes cipher suites, protocols, and client authentication settings. Can be applied to SSLSocket, SSLServerSocket, and SSLEngine.

constructors.description: Constructs SSLParameters with default values for cipher suites and protocols.

params.name: cipherSuites
params.description: The array of cipher suite names, or null

constructors.description: Constructs SSLParameters from an array of cipher suites. Protocols are set to default values.

params.name: cipherSuites
params.description: The array of cipher suite names, or null

params.name: protocols
params.description: The array of protocol names, or null

constructors.description: Constructs SSLParameters from an array of cipher suites and protocols.

methods.name: getCipherSuites

returns.description: The array of cipher suite names, or null

methods.description: Returns a copy of the array of cipher suites, or null if none have been set.

methods.name: setCipherSuites

params.name: cipherSuites
params.description: The array of cipher suite names, or null

methods.description: Sets the array of cipher suites.

methods.name: getProtocols

returns.description: The array of protocol names, or null

methods.description: Returns a copy of the array of protocols, or null if none have been set.

methods.name: setProtocols

params.name: protocols
params.description: The array of protocol names, or null

methods.description: Sets the array of protocols.

methods.name: getEndpointIdentificationAlgorithm

returns.description: The endpoint identification algorithm (e.g., HTTPS, LDAPS), or null

methods.description: Gets the endpoint identification algorithm. Returns null if no algorithm has been set.

methods.name: setEndpointIdentificationAlgorithm

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The algorithm name (e.g., HTTPS), or null to disable

methods.description: Sets the endpoint identification algorithm. If the algorithm is non-null or non-empty, the endpoint identification/verification procedures must be handled during SSL/TLS handshaking.

methods.name: getNeedClientAuth

returns.description: True if client authentication is required

methods.description: Returns whether client authentication should be required.

methods.name: setNeedClientAuth

params.name: needClientAuth
params.description: Whether client authentication is required

methods.description: Sets whether client authentication should be required. Calling this method clears the wantClientAuth flag.

methods.name: getWantClientAuth

returns.description: True if client authentication is requested

methods.description: Returns whether client authentication should be requested.

methods.name: setWantClientAuth

params.name: wantClientAuth
params.description: Whether client authentication is requested

methods.description: Sets whether client authentication should be requested. Calling this method clears the needClientAuth flag.
